intro: Crocus dianthus, commonly known as the Persian crocus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Iridaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters and produces showy blooms in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained soil in full sun. Crocus dianthus is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia.
